title: Mobile Microlearning-Based Short-Intensive Adult Information Literacy Course

context.prior_knowledge: Basic smartphone usage skills and mathematics learning experience
context.additional_context: A course focused on cultivating information evaluation and application skills linked to mathematics, accessible exclusively via smartphones in environments without PC access

learning_goals: Learners can identify three or more reliable sources of information required for mathematical problem-solving and select credible materials.
Learners can apply and explain five or more criteria for evaluating the reliability of information collected via smartphones.
Learners are assessed on their ability to process digital information related to mathematical concepts through a three-stage process: search, analysis, and integration.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
